page.title: 19Carlton Park Estate.
page.content: Carleton Park started as rough land gradually sloping downhill.By 1957 the land had been cleared and roads had been built.It was left for 2 years until 1959 when the first houses were lived in .They were sold as private homes .One of the first streets was Baden Powell Cresent. Gradually more and more streets were built. The estate was being developed quickly .It was being built gradually down the hill.In 1965 a Co-op grocery shop opened at the end of Pease Close,over the road.Then for business reasons.Pease Close was also built by the Council and sold as private homes.Pease Close was ready by 1961. After Pease Close the houses in Robson Close and downwards are Council houses unless they have been bought back as private homes as a few have. by Steven Davis,aged 11.
